posts.post_content:
I quite like seeing functional reprints like this. Llanowar Elves is from a different era and has had a very long and fruitful reign.   
  
I actually prefer the flavor of [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf) and it's ability to combo well with the myriad of land untapping and enchanting abilities in Green.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (7/10/2013 6:06:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like this. [Arbor Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arbor Elf) was kind of cool when you have a shockland, but he was also kind of a whiff when you draw all checklands and/or something non-Forest like [Sacred Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sacred Foundry). This is more consistent.  
  
(Although this doesn't help you cast [Boros Reckoner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boros Reckoner) like [Avacyn's Pilgrim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn's Pilgrim) does. You could try to mitigate this issue with [Burning-Tree Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Burning-Tree Emissary), which allows you to cast Reckoner starting with say GGRR...)
posts.html:
I like this. Arbor Elf was kind of cool when you have a shockland, but he was also kind of a whiff when you draw all checklands and/or something non-Forest like Sacred Foundry. This is more consistent.

(Although this doesn't help you cast Boros Reckoner like Avacyn's Pilgrim does. You could try to mitigate this issue with Burning-Tree Emissary, which allows you to cast Reckoner starting with say GGRR...)

posts.post_content: **[Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves)** VS **[Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic)**, both Elf Druids, both 1/1's, both cost ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol), both have same abilities, the only difference, the names and flavor texts. I know it's giving Tribal Elf decks big opportunities, but make it easier on our part Wizards... Now I'm gonna have to drive to my shop and trade my 4x **[Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves)** for 4x **[Elvish Mystic](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Mystic)**s.
posts.html:
Llanowar Elves VS Elvish Mystic, both Elf Druids, both 1/1's, both cost , both have same abilities, the only difference, the names and flavor texts. I know it's giving Tribal Elf decks big opportunities, but make it easier on our part Wizards... Now I'm gonna have to drive to my shop and trade my 4x Llanowar Elves for 4x Elvish Mystics.
